properties.name: Apothecary
properties.summary: Apothecary is a Rare Support champion from the High Elves faction. He is widely regarded as one of the best Rares in the game, providing a powerful speed boost, turn meter fill, and a strong single-target heal. His default skill also hits three times, making him excellent for the Fire Knight. He is an S-tier champion who can carry accounts through all stages of the game.

skills.name: Scatterbolt
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy 3 times. Each hit has a 15% chance of placing a 15% [Decrease SPD] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Soothing Word
skills.description: Heals a target ally. The heal can be critical.

skills.name: Stimulating Rush
skills.description: Places a 30% [Increase SPD] buff on all allies for 2 turns. Fills the Turn Meter of all allies by 15%.

investment_analysis.notes: Apothecary is one of the best investments a player can make. Booking his skills is crucial to reduce their cooldowns. A 6-star rank is essential to maximize his speed and survivability, allowing him to be used in all end-game content.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: A game-changing champion who will be the best support on any new account.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: The core of most dungeon, Clan Boss, and Arena teams, providing unmatched speed and healing for his rarity.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: Even in the late game, Apothecary remains a top-tier option for Fire Knight, Faction Wars, and as a speed booster in specific Arena and Doom Tower teams.

properties.name: Castigator
properties.summary: Castigator is a Rare Defense champion from the Banner Lords faction. He is a defensive champion with a kit focused on removing buffs from enemies and placing Block Buffs debuffs. His utility is niche, and he is primarily used in Faction Wars.

skills.name: Castigate

skills.name: Shield Breaker
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Damage increases by 30% if the target is under a [Shield] buff.

investment_analysis.notes: Castigator is a very niche champion, and investment is generally not recommended. His single-target focus and low overall impact make him a poor choice for most content.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: Can be situationally useful against bosses with powerful buffs.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: His value is almost entirely limited to the Banner Lords Faction Wars.

title: Raid Shadow Legends Champion v2.3

properties.name: Coldheart
properties.summary: Coldheart is a Rare Attack champion from the Dark Elves faction. She is one of the most famous and sought-after Rares in the game, renowned for her 'Heartseeker' skill, which deals massive damage based on enemy MAX HP and fully depletes their turn meter. This makes her an S-tier champion for Fire Knight, Spider's Den, and many other bosses.

skills.name: Art of Pain
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy 4 times. Each hit has a 25% chance of placing a 50% [Heal Reduction] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Heartseeker
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Damage increases according to enemy MAX HP. Decreases the target's Turn Meter by 100%.

skills.name: Flurry of Arrows
skills.description: Attacks all enemies. Has a 30% chance of placing a 5% [Poison] debuff for 2 turns.

investment_analysis.notes: Coldheart is a top-tier investment. Booking her 'Heartseeker' skill is mandatory to reduce its cooldown. A 6-star rank is essential to maximize her critical damage and to give her the survivability she needs, as she is notoriously fragile.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: A game-changing pull that will revolutionize any account's ability to clear dungeons.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: The cornerstone of Fire Knight and Spider speed teams.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: Remains one of the best boss killers in the entire game, regardless of rarity. She is used in virtually all end-game dungeon and Doom Tower speed-farming teams.

properties.name: Elhain
properties.summary: Elhain is one of the four starting champions and a Rare Attack champion from the High Elves faction. She is a powerful area-of-effect damage dealer with two AoE skills, making her an excellent campaign farmer and wave clearer for dungeons. She is a solid choice for new players and remains useful throughout the game.

skills.name: Keen Shot
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Places an extra hit if the target has more than 50% HP.

skills.name: Lightning Arrow
skills.description: Attacks all enemies.

skills.name: Valley of Death
skills.description: Attacks all enemies 2 times.

investment_analysis.notes: As a starter champion, Elhain is a fantastic investment. Booking her skills is easy and effective. A 6-star rank is the first major goal for any new account to turn her into a fast and efficient campaign farmer.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: The best champion on a new account. She is the primary campaign farmer, Arena nuker, and dungeon wave clearer.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: Remains a strong damage dealer for dungeons and is a key champion for the High Elves Faction Wars.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: While often replaced by stronger nukers, she remains a viable option for Faction Wars and can be used in specific 'nuke' strategies for Arena and Doom Tower.

properties.name: Eviscerator

skills.name: Exsanguinate
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Has a 20% chance of placing a 50% [Heal Reduction] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Rupture
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Will ignore [Shield] buffs.

skills.name: Spiked Armor (Passive)
skills.description: Has a 15% chance of returning 30% of the damage received from a single hit.

investment_analysis.notes: Eviscerator is a very niche champion, and investment is not recommended. Her role as a shield counter is better performed by champions who can remove or steal shields from the entire enemy team.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: Limited use for new players.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: Can be a surprise pick in Arena against certain teams, but is generally not a priority.

properties.name: Frozen Banshee
properties.summary: Frozen Banshee is a Rare Attack champion from the Undead Hordes faction. She is arguably the best poisoner in the game for single-target encounters, especially the Clan Boss. Her unique passive allows her to place poisons whenever an enemy under her Poison Sensitivity debuff is attacked, leading to an unparalleled amount of poison damage.

skills.name: Death Rattle
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy 2 times. Each hit has a 40% chance of placing a 5% [Poison] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Frost Blight
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Places a 5% [Poison Sensitivity] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Banshee's Wail (Passive)
skills.description: Has a 50% chance of placing a 5% [Poison] debuff for 2 turns on an enemy whenever an ally attacks a target under a [Poison Sensitivity] debuff.

investment_analysis.notes: Frozen Banshee is a phenomenal investment. Booking her 'Frost Blight' skill is mandatory to reduce its cooldown to 3 turns, allowing for 100% uptime on Poison Sensitivity. A 6-star rank is essential for her to have the accuracy and survivability needed for end-game Clan Boss.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: A game-changing pull for any account, immediately becoming the best poisoner for Clan Boss and Dragon.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: The core of most mid-game Clan Boss teams, enabling players to reach higher chests and rewards.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: Remains the best-in-slot poisoner for many end-game Clan Boss teams, often out-damaging Legendary champions. She is a must-build champion for any account focused on Clan Boss.

progression_timeline.mid_game_value: His primary use is in Faction Wars to control waves of enemies.

properties.name: Kael
properties.summary: Kael is one of the four starting champions and a Rare Attack champion from the Dark Elves faction. He is arguably the most versatile of the starters, bringing a strong area-of-effect nuke and, most importantly, the ability to place multiple poisons. This makes him an excellent campaign farmer, a solid Arena nuker, and a top-tier damage dealer for Clan Boss and Dragon early on.

skills.name: Dark Bolt
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Has an 80% chance of placing a 2.5% [Poison] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Acid Rain
skills.description: Attacks all enemies. Has a 15% chance to instantly activate a [Poison] debuff on each target.

skills.name: Disintegrate
skills.description: Attacks 4 times at random. Has a 40% chance of placing a 5% [Poison] debuff for 2 turns.

investment_analysis.notes: Kael is the best starter champion to invest in for overall progression. Booking him is easy and highly effective. A 6-star rank is the first major goal for any new account to turn him into a fast campaign farmer and a primary damage dealer for Clan Boss and Dragon.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: The best champion on a new account. He excels as a campaign farmer, Arena nuker, and is the best early-game Clan Boss poisoner.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: Remains a top-tier damage dealer for dungeons and Clan Boss until specialized champions like Frozen Banshee are acquired. He is a key champion for the Dark Elves Faction Wars.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: While his role as a primary poisoner diminishes, he remains a strong AoE damage dealer for Faction Wars and can be used in specific speed-farming teams for dungeons.

She also provides a team-wide heal, making her a versatile and highly valuable support champion.

skills.name: Spectacular Sweep
skills.description: Attacks all enemies. Fills the Turn Meter of all allies by 10%.

investment_analysis.notes: Booking her 'Team Assault' skill is mandatory to reduce its cooldown, which is essential for her role in speed-tuned Clan Boss teams. A 6-star rank is highly recommended to maximize her HP and survivability.

progression_timeline.mid_game_value: A game-changing champion for Clan Boss, enabling players to build their first unkillable teams.

properties.name: Paragon
properties.summary: Paragon is a Rare Support champion from the Dark Elves faction. He is one of the most infamous 'cheese' champions in the game due to his ability to place an Unkillable buff on himself or an ally. This allows him to single-handedly beat certain content, like the Nether Spider or specific campaign stages, that would otherwise be impossible at a low level.

skills.name: Strike Down
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Has a 20% chance of placing a 50% [Decrease ATK] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Unkillable
skills.description: Places an [Unkillable] buff on a target ally for 2 turns.

skills.name: Insurmountable (Passive)
skills.description: Increases this Champion's RES by 10 for each buff on them.

investment_analysis.notes: For his specific cheese role, booking his 'Unkillable' skill is mandatory to get it on a 2-turn cooldown. He should be kept at a low level (e.g., 30 or 40) and low HP so that bosses target him. Do not rank him to 6-star if you intend to use him for cheesing.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: Can be used to cheese difficult campaign stages to get 3 stars.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: His primary use is to cheese the Nether Spider in Doom Tower.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: A highly niche specialist whose value is entirely dependent on the need for his Unkillable cheese strategy.

She is one of the best Rare supports in the game, offering a unique combination of a full team cleanse, a revive, and continuous healing. Her versatile kit makes her an S-tier champion for dungeons, Faction Wars, and Doom Tower.

skills.name: Reverence
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Has a 25% chance of placing a 30% [Decrease SPD] debuff for 2 turns.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: A fantastic support who can carry a new account through difficult content.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: A core member of dungeon and Faction Wars teams, providing unmatched utility for a Rare champion.

properties.name: Renegade

She is a highly sought-after champion for one specific reason: her ability to reduce the cooldown of all ally skills. This makes her a key component of many end-game speed-farming teams for dungeons and Doom Tower, allowing powerful nukers to use their skills more frequently.

skills.name: Shadow Strike
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Has a 25% chance of placing a 2.5% [Poison] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Sacrifice

skills.name: Abyssal Pact

progression_timeline.early_game_value: Her role is very specific and not generally useful for new accounts.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: Begins to shine as players start building specialized speed teams for dungeons.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: A key component of many end-game speed-farming strategies for dungeons and Doom Tower, where resetting cooldowns is crucial.

properties.name: Seducer

He is a solid defensive support champion, bringing an area-of-effect Decrease Attack debuff and a team-wide Block Debuffs buff. His kit provides good survivability and protection, making him a valuable asset for Faction Wars and early-to-mid game dungeons.

skills.name: Grave Touch
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Has a 20% chance of placing a 50% [Decrease ATK] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Temptation
skills.description: Attacks all enemies. Has a 30% chance of placing a 50% [Decrease ATK] debuff for 2 turns.

skills.name: Aura of Seduction
skills.description: Places a [Block Debuffs] buff on all allies for 1 turn.

investment_analysis.notes: Booking his skills is important to reduce their cooldowns, especially for his Block Debuffs. However, his overall impact is not high enough to warrant a 6-star rank unless he is a key part of your Undead Hordes Faction Wars team.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: A good defensive support for new players, helping to mitigate damage and block debuffs.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: His primary use is in the Undead Hordes Faction Wars, where his kit is quite valuable.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: Not used in late-game content, as he is outclassed by champions with more powerful versions of his buffs and debuffs.

title: Raid Shadow Legends Champion v2.3
description: A comprehensive, revised template for storing Raid Shadow Legends champion data. This version introduces a categorized rating system and provides complete, step-by-step mastery paths.

properties.name: Armiger
properties.summary: Armiger is an Uncommon Defense champion from the Sacred Order faction. Despite his low rarity, he is one of the best turn meter control champions in the entire game. His default skill reduces the enemy's turn meter, and his second skill deals damage based on enemy MAX HP. This makes him an S-tier champion for Spider's Den, Fire Knight, and various Doom Tower bosses.

skills.name: Lacerate
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Decreases the target's Turn Meter by 30% if this attack is critical.

skills.name: Lay to Rest
skills.description: Attacks 1 enemy. Damage increases according to enemy MAX HP.

investment_analysis.notes: Armiger is an incredible investment for any account. Booking his second skill is beneficial, but his primary value comes from his default skill, which requires no books. A 6-star rank is essential to give him the stats (especially CRIT RATE, ACC, and DEF) needed to perform his role in end-game content.

progression_timeline.early_game_value: A surprisingly powerful champion who can help new players control dungeon bosses.
progression_timeline.mid_game_value: Becomes a core member of Fire Knight and Spider teams, enabling progression to stage 20.
progression_timeline.late_game_value: Remains a top-tier turn meter controller, used in many end-game speed teams for dungeons and for controlling bosses in Doom Tower Hard.
